args: I call upon the power of the pact!\n...Now, everyone! With me!
Why, this is the futile, ugly conflict you so\nabhor. Can't you tell?
We can't take any more of this...\nRetreat! All units, retreeeat!
The Empire is fleeing! We've won the day!
Goodness! It's over already?\nThat was even faster than I anticipated.
Is it a common occurrence for the Empire\nto attack and you to drive them off?
It certainly is. Even we dragons need to\nprotect ourselves from danger, no?

Even if one side doesn't want to fight,
once the battle has started, they often
can't extricate themselves from it—and
{player_name} is no exception.
So humans cannot stop their conflicts?\nBut then what of the sights I saw back\nat the Halidom?
I am confused. Can people truly coexist\nalongside us, or must they be managed?
Don't know the answer, eh? Yet earlier\nyou said you felt like you understood.
Then tell me the answer, Lightwyrm!\nWhat is the correct path? What must I do?
Oh, I think you'll just have to noodle over\nthat one yourself.
Hey, I'm not going to rush this part!\nNot when you're finally starting to change\nand become a little bit interesting.
Heh heh! Well, you just get to noodling,\nand I'll be all ears when you eventually\nfind the answer. Byeeee!
Well then? Do you still loathe humans?
My hatred toward your kind burns\never bright. And yet...
And yet I must admit I felt a pang of\nskepticism about this view when I saw\nwhat life was like in the Halidom.
Sounds like your opinion has changed.

Changed? No. It's true that your words and
deeds began to sway me for a moment,
but then I bore witness to the ugly fight
just now and was conflicted anew.

Which is the real you: the kind souls at
the Halidom or the bloodthirsty warriors
on the battlefield? My hate lacks direction!
I must know!
The Lightwyrm refused to help and instead\nabandoned me to this question, so I now\nfind myself confused once more.
Sounds like something he'd do.\nI wouldn't worry about it too much.

The Lightwyrm does what the Lightwyrm
wants, and what he wants is amusement.
I promise he's out there somewhere
chuckling at how he made you squirm.

You probably didn't have any doubts when
you were attacking the town, but then you
talked to Jupiter and they started to spring
up. Is that right?
The reason he was antagonistic toward\nall of us earlier was so he could get a\nchance to speak properly with you.
I admit I would not have listened to human\nwords in that moment save for his actions.
I think Jupiter really wanted you to\nadopt a new perspective—and he\nwanted you to change.

Yes, I see now. I was measuring the worth
of your kind by my values as a dragon,
for it is all I have had to go by during
these past three hundred years.
While I swore people had not changed in\nthat time, it was actually I who had been\nrendered immobile and static.
So what will you do now?

I do not know. But I will eventually find
the answer to my question—and when I
do, rest assured I will return to you and
convey it openly.
Heh heh. I can't wait to see what answer\nyou come up with, my friend.
Though as to whether it will make\nus friends or enemies...who can say?\nHeh heh heh!
